page.title: 08Organisations in Lyddington.
page.content: Despite the fact that the majority of people are commuters,organisations within the village are still available The Women's Institute meet once a month and has approximately sixteen members.Their ages range from 30 to 65 and consist of a mixture of old and new inhabitants.Few W.I.members support their county activities but local group meetings (with nearby villages) are popular;any village or church function is supported by the women i.e.The Flower Festival held in the church and the May Fair on the village green.The Parish Church is the link for all sections of the community in Lyddington.There is a Mother's Union and an active Sunday School.A senior citizen club known as the Horse shoe Club meet monthly.There are 60 members which includes people from other villages.
